briefTitle: Japan Statin Treatment Against Recurrent Stroke (J-STARS)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Ischemic stroke except for cardiogenic embolism, from 1 month to 3 years after onset
* Hyperlipidemia and total cholesterol level of 180-240mg/dl without the prescription of statin within previous 30 days
* Able to visit outpatient department
* Informed consent on the form.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Ischemic stroke of other determined cause according to the TOAST classification
* Ischemic heart disease and necessary to use statin
* Hemorrhagic disorders
* Platelet count \<=100,000/ul within 3 months prior to study start
* Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST)\>= 100IU/L within 3 months prior to study start
* Serum creatinine \>=2.0mg/dl within 3 months prior to study start
* A scheduled operation
* The presence of malignant disorder

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence Rate of Stroke and TIA
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence rate of patients with recurrent stroke of any type or transient ischemic attack (TIA)

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence Rate of Atherothrombotic Infarction
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence rate of patients with atherothrombotic infarction

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence Rate of Lacunar Infarction
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence rate of patients with lacunar infarction

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence Rate of Cardioembolic Infarction
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence rate of patients with cardioembolic infarction

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence Rate of Intracranial Hemorrhage
outcomeMeasures.description: Incidence rate of patients with intracranial hemorrhage
